title: Sausage, Arugula, and Piquillo Pepper Sandwiches
summary: Sausage, Arugula, and Piquillo Pepper Sandwiches might be just the main course you are searching for. One portion of this dish contains about 24g of protein, 14g of fat, and a total of 656 calories. For $2.9 per serving, this recipe covers 7% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 8. It is a good option if you're following a dairy free diet. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. Head to the store and pick up baby arugula, roasted peppers, ciabatta, and a few other things to make it today. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 20 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 25%. This score is rather bad. Similar recipes are Roasted Red Pepper and Mozzarella Sandwiches with Arugula Pesto, Sausage and Pepper Sandwiches from Denverâ€™s Paisano Sausage, and Sausage, Red Pepper and Arugula Pasta.
instructions: Preparation                                                        Combine olives and oil, then spread on bottom halves of rolls.                                                                 Heat a grill pan or large heavy skillet (not nonstick) over medium-high heat until hot, then heat sausages until hot, about 8 minutes.                                                                 Make sandwiches on rolls with peppers, sausages, and arugula. Cut in half.

steps.step: Combine olives and oil, then spread on bottom halves of rolls.
Heat a grill pan or large heavy skillet (not nonstick) over medium-high heat until hot, then heat sausages until hot, about 8 minutes.
Make sandwiches on rolls with peppers, sausages, and arugula.
